newsitem.title: CANADA: Inco appoints Gendron as Voisey's Bay chief.
newsitem.headline: Inco appoints Gendron as Voisey's Bay chief.

text.p: Inco Ltd has appointed longtime Inco executive Stewart Gendron as president of the Voisey's Bay Nickel Co.
Gendron will lead a new team to develop the nickel-copper-cobalt deposit at Voisey's Bay, Inco said in a statement.
Gendron, 53, joined the company in 1971. For the past year, he has been vice-president of milling, smelting and refining at Inco's Copper Cliff complex near Sudbury, Ontario.
Gendron's appointment starts immediately in St. John's, Newfoundland.
The Voisey's Bay Nickel Co became a wholly-owned subsidiary of Inco on Wednesday, when Inco's takeover of Diamond Fields Resources Inc was finalized.
